column4: I'm reading good things in general, but I hadn't found that one.
When we close the lid on this Toshiba laptop, it doesn't even try to suspend.
Instead, when we open it back up, it asks for a password.
Can anyone shed light on why this might be?
because the Toshiba kernel module doensnt load with all Toshiba laptops
i have the same problem
i think it is fixable, if you want to mess with the code in the kernel module
Shriek!
well mine does nothing, but in windows it goes in standby mode
That's what I'd expect.
try to modprobe something like toshiba-acpi
What would that do
with fnfx it an app especially for toshiba hardware
fnfx?
you have to get it
OK, how?
sudo apt-get install fnfxd
its a daemon running in the background
yeah it should do that
modprobe toshiba-acpi responds with "fatal error: could not open /proc/acpi/toshiba/keys"
Big scary error I don't understand when modprobeing toshiba-acpi
yeah i know, the same thing here, that is because it doesnt work with all Toshiba laptops
So what's happened here, just to be clear, is that we've tried to insert a special toshiba kernel module for ACPI, and it's failed for some reason
